intro: Fiwa longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved fiwa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Fiwa longifolia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
